events.event_description: The US added 5.2 billion cubic feet per day (Bcf/d) of natural gas intrastate pipeline capacity, significantly outpacing interstate additions which totaled less than 1.0 Bcf/d.
events.citation: In 2023, 5.2 billion cubic feet per day (Bcf/d) of natural gas intrastate pipeline capacity was added in the United States, according to our recently updated Natural Gas Pipeline Projects Tracker.

events.event_description: Enterprise Products Partners completed a 0.4 Bcf/d capacity expansion of the Acadian System through the Haynesville Extension project.
events.citation: Enterprise Products Partners' Acadian Haynesville Extension: A 0.4 Bcf/d capacity expansion with added compression on the Acadian System, which delivers natural gas from the Haynesville producing region in northwestern Louisiana to U.S. Gulf Coast markets

events.event_description: Kinder Morgan completed a new 2.0 Bcf/d Eagle Ford Pipeline project connecting Freer to Sinton, Texas.
events.citation: Kinder Morgan's Eagle Ford Project: A new 2.0 Bcf/d pipeline that begins at the Kinder Morgan Texas Pipeline compressor station in Freer, Texas; extends to the Kinder Morgan Tejas Pipeline system near Sinton, Texas

events.event_description: DTE Midstream completed Phases 1 and 2 of the LEAP Expansion, adding 0.7 Bcf/d capacity through system looping and compression.
events.citation: DTE Midstream's Louisiana Energy Access Project (LEAP) Expansion Phases 1 and 2: A combined expansion of 0.7 Bcf/d achieved by looping and compression of the LEAP system

events.event_description: TC Energy completed the North Baja Xpress Project, expanding capacity by 0.5 Bcf/d through compressor and meter station upgrades.
events.citation: TC Energy's North Baja Xpress Project: A 0.5 Bcf/d expansion, consisting mostly of new compressors and meter station upgrades, on the North Baja Pipeline in Arizona and California

events.event_description: WBI Energy Transmission completed the Grasslands South Expansion, a new 15-mile lateral pipeline providing 0.1 Bcf/d capacity from the Bakken region.
events.citation: WBI Energy Transmission's Grasslands South Expansion: A new 15-mile lateral pipeline providing 0.1 Bcf/d of incremental capacity to deliver natural gas from the Bakken producing region in North Dakota to an interconnection in Wyoming
